provider.name: Stephen McCarthy
provider.positioning: Evidence-based care focused on significant medical weight loss, metabolic health, hormone optimization, and selected wellness programs.
notes_for_ai: Do not present information as medical advice. Encourage booking a consultation for individualized guidance.
Do not establish a provider-patient relationship through chat.

service_states.telehealth_location_rule: Patient must be physically located in a state where the provider is licensed at the time of the telehealth visit.

global_disclosures: Information provided by chat is for general informational purposes only and is not medical advice.
Do not submit sensitive personal health information (PHI) through chat or website forms.
If you think you have a medical emergency, call 911 or go to the nearest emergency room.
Controlled substances are not prescribed at this time.
Labs and medications are typically billed separately from membership fees unless explicitly stated.

deposit_policy.purpose: Reduce no-shows and reserve provider time.
how_it_works: A $50 deposit is collected at scheduling to hold your appointment.
The deposit is applied to your onboarding/initial visit fee or first month membership if you enroll.
If you cancel or reschedule with at least 24 hours notice, the deposit can be transferred to a new appointment time.
If you cancel with less than 24 hours notice or do not show, the deposit is forfeited.
exceptions: One courtesy reschedule may be offered at the practice's discretion for unexpected circumstances.
deposit_policy.ai_guidance: If a user disputes a fee or asks for an exception, route them to the practice to review.

cancellation: Members can request cancellation any time unless a minimum term applies.
Cancellation takes effect at the end of the current billing period (no partial-month refunds).
refunds: Membership fees are generally non-refundable once the month begins, because provider time and support are reserved.

no_show_policy.initial_visit: Deposit is forfeited if no-show or late cancellation (<24 hours).
no_show_policy.follow_up_visits: May be charged a missed-visit fee or require a deposit for rescheduling.

chat_scope: Chat can help with pricing, what programs include, how to get started, and general process questions.
Chat cannot provide individualized treatment plans or diagnose conditions.
privacy_and_communication.hipaa_note: Chat and website forms are not intended for exchanging sensitive medical details.

programs.name: Significant Medical Weight Loss (Metabolic Medicine)
programs.short_description: Clinician-guided weight loss program focused on meaningful, sustained fat loss and metabolic health using lifestyle strategy and evidence-based medications when appropriate.
who_its_for: Adults who want significant, sustainable weight loss
People struggling with hunger, cravings, plateauing, or metabolic resistance
Patients interested in GLP-1-based options (if clinically appropriate)
who_it_may_not_be_for: People seeking a one-time prescription without follow-up

includes: Medical history review and goal setting
Baseline plan and discussion of options
Review of expected labs and monitoring

tiers.name: Metabolic Reset (Essential)
includes: Personalized nutrition/activity plan
Medication review and non-controlled options when appropriate
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Metabolic Reset (Comprehensive)
includes: More time for troubleshooting plateaus and side effects
Lab review as clinically indicated
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Metabolic Reset (Intensive)
includes: Extra check-in for adherence, adjustments, and momentum
Priority messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

common_medication_discussion_topics: GLP-1 medications (e.g., semaglutide) and GLP-1/GIP medications (e.g., tirzepatide) if clinically appropriate
Evidence-based non-controlled oral options when appropriate

frequently_asked_questions.q: Is medication included in the membership?
frequently_asked_questions.a: No. Membership covers your visits, plan, and support. Labs and medications are billed separately unless explicitly stated.

frequently_asked_questions.q: Do you offer semaglutide or tirzepatide?
frequently_asked_questions.a: If clinically appropriate, these options may be discussed. Final selection depends on your medical history, goals, and risk profile.

programs.name: Women’s Perimenopause & Menopause Hormone Therapy
programs.short_description: Evidence-based menopause/perimenopause support focused on symptom relief, quality of life, and safe monitoring. Therapy is individualized after evaluation and lab review as appropriate.
who_its_for: Women experiencing perimenopause or menopause symptoms
Patients seeking education, symptom tracking, and structured follow-up

includes: Symptom review and risk screening
Discussion of options and monitoring plan
Lab planning when clinically indicated

tiers.name: Menopause Relief (Foundation)
includes: Symptom-guided plan + education + monitoring
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Menopause Relief (Optimize)
includes: Extra check-in for adjustments and side effect management
Priority messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Menopause Relief (Comprehensive)
includes: Extended visit time for complex cases
Priority messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

frequently_asked_questions.a: Medication costs are billed separately. Your clinician will discuss options, risks, benefits, and monitoring during your consultation.

frequently_asked_questions.q: Can I do this via telehealth?
frequently_asked_questions.a: Yes, if you are physically located in a state where the provider is licensed at the time of the appointment (currently Pennsylvania; Utah is coming soon).

programs.name: Midlife Metabolic + Menopause Combined Program
programs.short_description: A combined membership for patients who want both significant weight loss support and menopause/perimenopause management with coordinated follow-up.

includes: Combined intake and coordinated plan across metabolic and menopause goals
Lab planning and prioritized next steps

tiers.name: Combined Program Membership
includes: Coordinated management across both programs
Priority messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

programs.name: Peptide Therapy (Recovery, Performance, Longevity Support)
programs.short_description: Clinician-guided peptide therapy for recovery and wellness goals when appropriate. Peptide selection and dosing are individualized after evaluation.

includes: Goal review and safety screening
Discussion of peptide options and expectations
Plan for follow-up and monitoring

tiers.name: Peptide Support (Standard)
includes: Protocol management and adjustments
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Peptide Support (Plus)
includes: More time for protocol refinement and troubleshooting
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

faq.a: Some peptides and related therapies are prescribed as compounded medications. Your clinician will discuss what is appropriate, the evidence, and safety considerations during your visit.

programs.name: Men’s Sexual Health (ED & Performance)
programs.short_description: Evaluation and management of erectile dysfunction and sexual performance concerns with a medical approach, labs when indicated, and prescription options when appropriate.

includes: Medical history and risk screening (including cardiovascular risk discussion)
Discussion of medication and lifestyle options
Lab planning when clinically indicated

tiers.name: Sexual Health (Standard)
includes: Medication management when appropriate
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Sexual Health (Plus)
includes: More frequent follow-up for optimization and side-effect management
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

medications_may_include: Tadalafil (Cialis) or sildenafil (Viagra) type medications when appropriate
PT-141 may be discussed for selected cases

faq.q: Can you prescribe ED meds via telehealth?
faq.a: If clinically appropriate and permitted under applicable regulations, ED medications can often be prescribed with telehealth. Your clinician will confirm eligibility during the visit.

programs.name: Hair Restoration (Men’s Hair Loss)
programs.short_description: Medical approach to male pattern hair loss using evidence-based options (e.g., oral/topical treatments) with monitoring and follow-up.

includes: Hair loss history review and goal setting
Discussion of evidence-based options and expectations
Plan for follow-up and photos for tracking

tiers.name: Hair Restoration (Standard)
includes: Treatment optimization and monitoring
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

tiers.name: Hair Restoration (Plus)
includes: More frequent check-ins for faster optimization
Secure messaging (response target: within 48 business hours)

common_medications_discussed: Minoxidil (topical or oral options may be discussed)

faq.q: How long until I see results?
faq.a: Hair restoration typically requires consistent treatment for several months before visible improvement. Your clinician will set expectations based on your case.

pharmacy_reference.purpose: Reference data for patient questions about typical cash pricing and shipping when using partner pharmacies. Prices may change.

farmaKeio.name: FarmaKeio Pharmacy Network
notes_for_ai: If asked about medication costs, emphasize that the pharmacy bills separately and prices vary by dose/quantity.
Provide ranges or examples, and encourage confirming exact pricing after the prescription is created.

terms.refrigerated_shipping: Complimentary overnight delivery for refrigerated orders

source_citations: FarmaKeio terms and dispensing fee + processing: 【1114:6†FarmaKeio Price List.pdf†L24-L45】
FarmaKeio injection examples (NAD+, PT-141, semaglutide, tirzepatide, sermorelin): 【1114:4†FarmaKeio Price List.pdf†L8-L22】

empower_or_t3_catalog.name: Patient-Specific Bill Clinic Catalog (T3) – Updated Feb 12, 2024
notes_for_ai: This catalog contains per-unit pricing examples that may be used as rough references.
Final patient pricing depends on pharmacy policies, prescription quantity, and dispensing/shipping fees.
source_citations: T3 catalog hair-loss combo and dutasteride examples: 【1114:1†Patient-Specific-Bill-Clinic-T3-Catalog 240212.pdf†L30-L60】

escalate_for_policy_exceptions: requests to send sensitive medical records through chat
handoff_rules.recommended_response_for_emergency: If you may be experiencing a medical emergency, call 911 or go to the nearest emergency room.

training_faq.q: How much do your programs cost?
training_faq.a: Lehigh Valley Wellness offers monthly memberships. Pricing depends on the program and level of support. Most programs also have an onboarding visit fee. Labs and medications are typically billed separately.
These programs are cash-pay memberships. You may be able to use insurance for certain labs or medications depending on your coverage, but membership fees are paid directly.

training_faq.q: Can I do telehealth if I live in another state?
training_faq.a: Telehealth is available when you are physically located in a state where the provider is licensed at the time of your visit. Currently Pennsylvania is available; Utah is coming soon.
Controlled substances are not prescribed at this time.

training_faq.q: Do I need a deposit to book?
training_faq.a: Yes. A $50 deposit holds your initial appointment and is applied to your visit fee or your first month if you enroll. It is forfeited for late cancellations (<24 hours) or no-shows.
